title: Application Procedure for Summer Classes {{year}}

step_1.title: STEP 1 : Online Application Form
step_1.description: Please follow the steps to complete online application.
step_1.login: 1. Log into <0>SAYT Application System</0>. (For first-time user, please register an account with your email. Even you were former EPYMT student, you still need a valid account to login.)
step_1.reminder_1: - Former EPYMT students must complete the form at the link under "Former EPYMT Applicant" of the online application.
step_1.reminder_2: - Application fee is HK$50 for each EPYMT course.
step_1.reminder_3: - Applicants who apply for more than one course should submit application separately for each course in the same account.
step_1.checkStatus: 3. Check application status. Applicants can also login the account to check their course result in the future.
step_1.remark: * It is not necessary to send any supporting documents at this stage.

step_2.title: STEP 2 : Admission Screening Test

formerStudents.title: Former students
formerStudents.description: Former students of EPYMT may enjoy exemption of admission screening tests under certain conditions. Please read the course webpage for requirements and complete the form under "Former EPYMT Applicant" of the online application.

localAndOverseasStudents.title: Local and Overseas students
localAndOverseasStudents.description: All local first-time applicants must attend the admission screening test on <0>{{admissionDate}}</0>. Failing to do so will be considered as withdrawing from the application.

step_2.details: The screening test is a take-home exam that assesses whether an applicant has acquired sufficient background knowledge to take EPYMT courses. The question paper will be sent to applicants at <0>10:00 on 31 May 2025 (Saturday)</0> by email. Answers should be scanned, combined into a single PDF file, and submitted to the link provided in the email before <0>17:00 on 2 June 2025 (Monday)</0>. Late submissions may not be considered.

remark: Attention: The learning pace is fast and the schedule is tight. It <0>requires tremendous effort</0> and commitment from students to truly benefit from the programme. Absence and withdrawal are detrimental to learning, and we will also strictly follow the university regulations on matters related to taking leave and withdrawal.
